page.description: We are excited to announce the next release of Alpha TransForm is now available for preview. Over the next two weeks, we invite you to try the new features and identify any issues in your existing Form Designs and Integrations to ensure a seamless transition to the new version of Alpha TransForm.

discussion.p: We've added a lot of new features to this release, including:

item.name: Form Dispatch from directly within TransForm Central
Expanded Customization when designing Forms with new Styles for Headings, Pages, and Buttons
Redesigned Look for the TransForm app
Customizable Sorting and Grouping for forms in the TransForm app

discussion.p: We've setup a test site and mobile test channel with a sandboxed database so that you can test your forms and integrations without affecting your TransForm users. You can find information about how to access the Spring 2020 Preview, as well as detailed information about new features and bug fixes, in this document. Be sure to notify us about any issues you find by sending an email to tfservice@alphasoftware.com.

section.title: Installing the Alpha TransForm App Beta

description.p: Launch Alpha TransForm on your mobile device.
If you have any unsaved forms, Save and Upload your forms to the TransForm Cloud.
Tap the "hamburger" icon in the upper left corner to open the menu.
Tap "Help".
Tap "Show TOC".
Tap "Tools for Support".
Locate the Production and Test buttons and tap "Test".
Tap "Exit Help" to exit the Help.
Log out of Alpha TransForm and close the app on your mobile device.
Re-launch Alpha TransForm and log in.
You're ready to start testing!

group.title: What's new in the Spring 2020 Preview

description.p: We've made dispatch easier with the new Bulk Dispatch Action. This action will generate an Excel file that you can use to define one or more forms to dispatch to your TransForm users.
To use this action:
Log into TransForm Central at the beta URL:
On the Home tab, click "Dispatch forms" in the More section.
Select the form types you want to dispatch in Step 1.
Click "Download Excel Template".
When the Excel file is ready, a message will appear below the "Download Excel Template" button. Click "click here to download the template" to download the Excel file.
Enter the dispatch information in the Excel file and save your changes. For details on how to fill out the Excel file, go to:
*[extlink:http://aadocuments.s3.amazonaws.com/transformcentral/documentation/exceltemplate.htm@http://aadocuments.s3.amazonaws.com/transformcentral/documentation/exceltemplate.htm]*
When you're ready, click "Upload Excel file" and upload the Excel file that contains the forms you want to dispatch.

Form sorting in the TransForm app can now be customized for your TransForm Account. The Sort menu in the TransForm app includes several additional options for sorting and grouping forms: "Date", "Status", "Form", "Status,Form", and "Form,Status".
Sorting options can be customized by defining a grouping specification in the On-device Assets Policy for your TransForm Account. The default grouping specification is shown below:

The grouping specification is an array of one or more sort definitions that define the sortid, the text shown for the Sort menu in the TransForm app, how many levels data is sorted, and the fields to sort on. The sort definitions can also include an optional icon which is shown in the Sort menu next to the text.
The grouping specification is added to the policy in the On-device Assets Policy:
REQUIRED, string, The sort id. The id must be unique within your TransForm Account. Set to "none" to use as the default sort.
REQUIRED, string, The text shown in the TransForm app sort menu.
REQUIRED, number, The number of grouping levels. If levels is 0, forms are not grouped but are sorted using the rules defined in fields.
Optional, string, An icon shown next to the text in the TransForm app Sort menu. Can be "up" or "down".
For example:

REQUIRED, object array, An array of zero or more objects that defines how the forms are sorted. If fields is empty, the forms are sorted by Date Created in ascending order. See the default grouping specification above for an example.
Each object in the array must define the following settings:
REQUIRED, string, The form field to sort. This can be a field in the form, a special form field, or a system field. [List of Sorting Fields] for more information.
REQUIRED, The label shown next to the group field value.
REQUIRED, boolean, A true or false value. If true, forms will be sorted by the defined field in ascending order. If false, forms will be sorted in descending order.
For example:
Optional, object, Contains details about how to treat the sort value and how to display the sort value in the Group. The object can define the following settings:
Optional, number, The number of characters from the sort field to use in the sort comparison.
Optional, string, The format for the sort field data. The format can be one of the following values:

item.name: "date" - Formats sort field value as a date. Uses the format "Mon d, yyyy"
"longdate" - Formats sort field value as a date. Uses the format "Mon d, yyyy"
"shortdate" - Formats sort field value as a date. Uses an abbreviated format.
"first" - Displays the first X characters of the sort field value where X is the value of options.first.

onSubmit events can now be viewed as a list. The list view of the onSubmit events gives you the ability to see what events exist for your TransForm Account. The list view is read-only. Any changes to the onSubmit event must be done by editing the JSON definition either directly in TransForm Central or using the Alpha TransForm API.

The Template Picker, shown when creating a new Form Design from a Template, has been given a face lift. This upgrade not only makes it easier for you to pick a template, but it also allows us to more quickly publish new templates for you to use in your TransForm account.

The TransForm app has a completely new look throughout. The new look applies not only to the interface, but to forms as well. If you have any highly-customized forms in TransForm, you will definitely want to test them with the new look.

You have full access to your User Account Preferences from with the TransForm app. Change your password, display name, as well as your notification preferences directly in the app without logging into TransForm Central.
To change User Account Preferences:
Log into the TransForm app on your mobile device.
Tap the 'hamburger' menu to open the Menu on the Form List page.
Tap 'User Settings'.
Edit the desired preferences.
If you changed your User Name or Password, log out and log in again for the changes to take effect.
The User Settings submenu has the following options:

item.name: User Preferences
item.description: Change your notification preferences for when a form is dispatched to you. See [Dispatch Notifications] above in the TransForm Central Features section for more details.

item.name: Change Password
item.description: Change your TransForm password.

item.name: Change Display Name
item.description: Change the Display Name shown for your user name. If no Display Name is defined, your email is shown.

description.p: Changing User Account Preferences does not work offline. You must be connected to the internet to update your preferences.

Users will no longer be required to log into TransForm Central to reset their password. If you forget your password, you can use the new "Forgot your password?" link on the login page in the TransForm app. Simply enter your TransForm user name in the "Login Name" field and tap "Forgot your password?". TransForm will send instructions on how to reset your password to the email address you used to create your TransForm account.
Resetting your password does not work offline. You must be connected to the internet to reset your password.

section.title: Delete, Duplicate, and Upload Multiple forms

description.p: Delete, duplicate, or upload select forms in the TransForm app using the new Edit list feature. Edit list, located at the top of the form list, can be used to make bulk changes to your TransForm forms.
To Delete, Duplicate, or Upload multiple forms:
Log into the TransForm app.
Tap "Edit List".
Tap each form that you would like to Delete, Duplicate, or Upload.
Tap the action you would like to perform:

item.name: Delete - Deletes the selected forms. This action cannot be undone!
Upload - Uploads the selected forms to TransForm Central

description.p: Confirm the action.

The TransForm app has a new Demo Mode that allows users to try TransForm without needing to create an account. Demo Mode includes a variety of sample forms that can be created and edited. Users cannot, however, upload their forms to the TransForm Cloud.
You can access Demo Mode on the Login screen by tapping the "Try a Demo Account" button located at the bottom of the screen.
Several new functions have been added to TPL:

The phonecall() function can be used to call a number on the local device. The function takes one argument, the phone number to dial. The phone number may only contain numbers, +, -, parentheses, spaces, commas, or semicolons.
*[Syntax]*
*[Arguments]*

item.name: *[tpl:phoneNumber]*
item.description: The string that contains the number to dial. The phoneNumber may be a combination of digits and the characters: +, -, space, parentheses, comma, and semicolon.

description.p: The code below demonstrates two ON events for two buttons. The first shows passing a field that contains the phone number to the phonecall() function. The second shows passing a static string to the function:

p.example:
ON *button_callSupport phonecall(#supportPhoneNumber) ENDON
ON *button_callSales salesNumber = "617-555-1234" phonecall(salesNumber) ENDON

The imageAsBase64() function returns a base64 data URL that may be needed for web services (such as OCR). The function takes one argument, the field that contains the photo. imageAsBase64() can be used with any photos, including new photos that have not been uploaded to the TransForm Cloud.
*[Syntax]*
*[Arguments]*

item.name: *[tpl:photoFieldValue]*
item.description: The field that contains the photo.

description.p: The example below demonstrates using imageAsBase64() to encode a photo and send it to the https://ocr.space service:

p.example:
ON *button_convertPhoto ^b64 = imageAsBase64(#photo) headers = "apikey:YOUR_API_KEY\nContent-Type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" body = "base64Image=" & encodeURIComponent(^b64)
r = ajaxSendRequest("POST", "https://api.ocr.space/Parse/Image", 60000, body, headers)
rjson = JSONparse(r.responseText)
if rjson.ParsedResults #ocrtext = rjson.ParsedResults[0].ParsedText else #ocrtext = "" endif
#ocrresults = rjson ENDON
